The new species most resembles
S. brachyurum
sp. nov. and
S. pyrrhonae
, but it is distinguished from them by the long malar space, 1.3–1.4 times as long as the basal mandibular width (0.9–1.2 times in
S. brachyurum
and
S. pyrrhonae
), and the yellowish white marking on the apex of the metasoma (entirely black in
S. brachyurum
and
S. pyrrhonae
).

HEAD. Vertex 0.4–0.5 times as long as maximum length of eye in dorsal view. Frons without a depression between eye and antennal socket in frontal view ( Fig. 2a ). Clypeus 0.5–0.7 times as long as wide, with three weak projections of equal size ( Figs 2a , 3a ). Face 0.7–0.8 times as long as wide. Length of malar space 1.3–1.4 times as long as basal mandibular width. Ocello-ocular line/lateral ocellar diameter

subSubSection.paragraph: = 1.1–1.3. Postocellar line/lateral ocellar diameter = 0.7–1.0. Antenna with 30–31 flagellomeres; first flagellomere 1.3–1.5 times as long as second flagellomere.

METASOMA. T1 1.9–2.2 times as long as maximum width, 1.9–2.2 times as long as T2. T2 0.7 times as long as maximum width. T1 sparsely punctate. T2–T8 densely punctate. S1 without distinct sharp projection basally. Ovipositor sheath 2.1–2.5 times as long as hind tibia.
Host unknown. Adults fly mainly in July and August.
